review_description: The interface is so mot intuitive....

I'm only able to play 3 songs then it stops streaming all songs. When I press the play button nothing happens. To fix, I have to restart the phone, logg out then in, or reinstall the apps. When either of those things are done, it still only plays 3 songs then stops playing again. This needs to be fixed or I'll switch to another service. I have a Samsung galaxy s22 ultra.

In the past I rated Spotify 5 stars. But for weeks now I have been having issues with the app. I'm using a premium account and when I click on a song it would show it's playing but it won't play any music, it loads I can see the icon picture and lyrics but its not playing the song. If it decides to play after 2 songs it stops again for hours, i would click play but it won't play out my songs. I have updated the app still the same thing.It makes me quite sad cause I love music. I hope they fix it

Generally a good service, but! I'm a traveler and digital nomad so I change my location quite often and in order to continue using Spotify I have to change my country in the settings if my account. Can't we make it automatically? It's quite outdated to bind people to an adress. While I can understand that there might be payment/currency issues, but even on the free version it's happening as well.
App keeps on crashing no matter how many times I reinstall it. Apps that require a paid subscription and when you are unable to make use of it are really a bummer.

The UI is atrocious. Clearly no one at spotify uses this or does any tests whatsoever. Where is everything? Literally every other Music app has a better UI. My Suggestion: Make it not atrocious. It also crashes randomly.
developer_response: Hey, thanks for the feedback. If you have specific suggestions on how to improve it, feel free to add them to our ‚ÄòIdeas Board‚Äô where others can show their support. Head to http://community.spotify.com > Menu > Ideas > Idea Submissions. Others will then be able to vote or add to the conversation to show their support.

review_description: I love to use it for music but after my "30 minutes of ad free music" ends I get an ad after every 2-3 songs unless I change my playlist. I can also play any song w/o shuffle on any other device rather than on my phone, which, imo, is quite stupid. It would be nice if they re-added that feature on phones w/o having to buy premium. All that aside, it's a good app to listen to music on if you have premium
Albums aren't loading. UI looks good. Please fix albums aren't loading
There's always some kind of technical difficulty happening within the app but usually quick to fix em. Other than that it's a great app for music. (Unless they keep removing stuff you like)
I dont pay for many services but Spotify Premium is worth it to me. Ive been able to rediscover music I had forgotten about and can always find a playlist to suit my mood.
My style of music, I get what I'm looking for and quickly
I can't open the play-pause-next button and song previewed anymore but the song still played, please fix this.

Not only do you not get to listen to any one particular song when you so wish to, it also has ads. The ads aren't a problem, because otherwise they wouldn't even offer free plans. The ads with the constant shuffle? Total garbage meant to ruin your day

Obvious stuff, they don't care about fixing long standing problems of their app on androids. I would appreciate if they could at least post the the version number of the last version that actually worked, so I wouldn't have to scour the internet to see what I can do to get a Spotify app that isn't half broken. But I guess that would also require admitting fault which I can only assume their attitude toward is "why bother‚Äù

This app has not worked for 2 months, can't open the app, only way to open it was long press the app then click the liked songs but then if you press the home button on the Spotify app then it crashes. For 2 months! Tried reinstall, clear data nothing works. Fix the app
Amazing user experience with plenty of options on music/podcasts

Ads just ruin it. Especially the AD that says enjoy the next 30mins add free. That's literally an ad saying there's no ads. Geez who doesn't have something that blocks ads nowadays? Going back to my ad blocker site. Not snitchin. Annoying app for me I'm sorry.
Yeah what is to add, best app to listen to music. Premium users on family plan, which is quite reasonably priced. Appreciate the music quality options for download/streaming.

This app is so bad just busy to show huge amount of ads after a nano second even i cant play a single song because of lengthy ads. its a waste of time to use this application . youtube and other apps are better than this app. Thank you. Ads is not everything spotify has to give skip button or something like that from which we can skip ads. this app making me angry because its wasting my time. im uninstalling this app and installing again soundcloud thats it.
Songs are not playing unless I close the app, open it and play the song again. I have to repeat the process for each song. Rating 1 star for you to take actions quickly, it's been a week.
Didn't realize how amazing Spotify is until I used Amazon Music (free trial). This app is far, far superior to Amazon Music. Very intuitive, quick, and does exactly what you want it to.

I used to love this app alot and i had considered upgrading to premium.. But these days its always acting up.. You listen to two songs then it doesn't play the next.. I've tried everything from rebooting my phone to uninstalling and reinstalling but it isn't budging... To be honest its quite irritating and frustrating.. I give it 2 stars for the respect i have for the app.. Please look into the matter
Please Fix the goddamn UI. It is getting frustrating to you use the app.

Big shoes to fill lol. My suggestion would be to keep a functional non expiring app that is free sure throw in adds you deserve to make money too. I rarely have the luxury of purchasing anything above my immediate required needs like many but when I can and I've given this a lot of thought over the years I will go with what I trust like sure I want music without ads so I would stick with the app I already have and trust but I wouldn't stick with a free app if I have to redownload it every week.

Craftmanship from USSR and a comic book villain capitalist ruling over it. Everything is made hard. Shuffle button behind a pay wall but why would you pay if the music keeps stopping at random and only way to fix it would be restarting the phone? If they want to sell the shuffle button they should at least show it in free version (grayed out for example). Not let people search the internet IF there even is an option

Most bugs and requests I have reported to Spotify have been fixed and developed. This is how developers should react to feedback. One bug though remains: A downloading notification for Spotify playlists, remains (when playlist is automatically renewed) even if the download is over and the only way to get rid of it is to tap on it thus opening the app. Then it immediately goes away. Ps. How about a new UI theme choice? :!-)

Spotify is a great service,but the app gets buggy sometimes. Managing podcasts can be a chore also, but overall it's pretty good. Miserable experience in the last week. Can't play a new songs for more than minutes, it freezes for no reason. Please fix this it's ruining the whole experience

songs often get stuck at 0:00 basically it didn't even play. i tried uninstalling and reinstalling it a quiet few times but it still happens. pls i beg you to fix this immediately, this app is my coping mechanism.

There are other apps too stop pretending like you're the only one out there spotify. Even if that doesn't work I can just pirate music. Other than you insisting that "you shall bear with the ads or perish" your service is actually pretty good, both sound quality and ui wise very pog.

I love this app. I love how it chooses just the right song based on my activy, unlike with other apps that chooses a way different genre of a song I'm playing which sucks. But I hope there could be a button or a feature wherein we don't have to swipe up for the lyrics every single time, just something that would show the lyrics automatically for all songs we're playing. If you get the idea? I'll be looking forward for it.

Free version is the worst. Try making a playlist and only listening to those songs. It's impossible. I don't want recommended music, I don't want similar music I only want to hear the music I selected to make a playlist. Give me All the ads you want but don't add music I didn't ask for and then penalize me for skipping them. This is the equivalent to bullying a person to pay for a service and I won't stand for it. If you choose to use the app don't do the free version cause you'll hate it

literally this was such a good music app but than after this dumb update it ruined everything now I can't even listen 2 the songs on my playlist to check them out real quick and than you always add songs to my playlist even when I add enough songs so you don't do that it's it's annoying I might just delete this app and find a different one to listen to music on.

I'm sick and tired of having unwanted suggested songs autoplay and shuffle in whenever I try to play a playlist, and being unable to skip them if I've used up the amount of skips given per hour. I can't even get rid of them from my queue without skipping even if I try to click off onto other playlists or close the app. Hiding the song does nothing to help either. PLEASE give us an option to remove suggested songs from our queue/let us edit what songs are coming up by having a music queue button!
There should be an option to download individual songs. Could also use an even a quicker way of adding a song to a playlist.

I pay for premium but it will not let me save downloaded songs to an SD card. It just keeps moving them back. I go off grid a lot so this is very, very frustrating as I run out of space quickly. I'll change my rating to five stars when this is resolved as I have no other issues to note!

The free version feels completely pointless, in it doesn't perform the most basic requirement of a music player - letting you pick songs you want to listen to, and listen to them. You can only give it a loose suggestion of what to play for you. And then you still get ads. I can't speak to the premium version, but the demo experience has done nothing to make me consider trying it. Just use youtube instead

This is quite possibly the worst app I've ever installed (uninstalled now). You can't listen to what you want, only what they force you to listen to. Search is useless. UI makes very little sense. Never using this awful rubbish ever again! Would give 0 stars if could
I hate your ads it ruins everything

Stops playing music/podcasts after 30 or so mins. There's no 'now playing' bar at the bottom anymore so you can't skip songs/skip/rewind on podcasts. Earbud button functionality has gone. Spotify need to sort this out in the next week or so or I'm going to cancel my sub

Latest update causes music player bar to sporadically disappear throughout the day (both in-app and out). Can't start music sometimes as well. Not to mention the UX changes made over the past couple of years making navigating my own saved music a hassle.
I don't know if it's the latest update, but after skipping 3 songs Spotify stops playing in my car. Every other app with sounds works, but Spotify just stops and the play button turns gray.

Spotify has been playing very well for me. However, I am dealing with an annoying bug in which the music only plays for close to 10 seconds before quitting. I would clear my cache, re-install, and even made sure to fix my battery optimization. It would play, but then it would cut the song off at odd times. I can't really subscribe to a service that isn't working like it should. I don't know what happened, but this isn't the Spotify I remembered using.

Horrible fake promotions , I opt for the premium plan which was availble for 120 /- after availing Student discount but after making the payment, debit amount was 450 /- and I didn't recieved any info why they have charged 3 times of original price. Also even after upgrading to premium, app still has some bugs, earlier download button was not working but after sometime it was working. I don't know why they have charged 450/- even after receiving receipt via mail showing Amt 120/-

I wish I could give 0 stars. I love Spotify so much but have been having major issues for years. I almost never update because every time I do something goes wrong which makes it unusable. Realized I hadn't updated since 2020, so I updated and it took me off of my premium family plan even though NO info changed, I can't see my playlists OR the play button/bar, and I have to close the app to get the audio to stop. Please fix this MESS of an App for real, this is ridiculous.
unpopular opinion but i actually like the newer player ui. nicely done spotify team. Try to make it a little less cluttered and your app will be even better

5 stars, the only thing that annoys me is when you accidentally click the like button on an old song that you liked, so you remove it from liked songs and you can't undo it. If it at least wasn't right next to play/pause button...

In the start it was quite good, last month ive been trying to fix it but cant, i only see the artist and the song title but when i click it its on a duration, please spotify fix this. Ive been uninstalling installing but stil not fixed.

My review has gone down a star or 2 due to the recent bug in mine where (in a premium family plan) I've been getting to where I will hit a song in a playlist and evertime I click on any song it will skip down like 5 songs! It did this a couple of days ago and now it's doing it again! I even Uninstalled and reinstalled and it still isn't working properly, get yourselves together. I have been using Spotify for my family and I since 2015. And I never intend to stop. It is my most used app on my phone. I love having Premium. The pre-made Playlists are great for indecisive people such as myself, that only know the mood they're in, and Spotify does all the rest!! They literally have everything you could ask for, and more!

Why does it require premium to skip songs more than 6 times an hour? So petty. "No, Jesse Pinkman, You can't skip songs until you pay ten bucks a month." Audiomack is better than this, and that's saying something.

Hello, Spotify team, Gives a clear button for recent played Because person to person they changes their mind for listening songs and that's annoying for hearing same songs in different mood or mindset of same person. So pleased, suggest this upgrade to your team leader, Thank you.

Has become such a pain that unless the next update fixes it I will be cancelling my premium account.

Use this app for quite a few years both as a free account and on premium. Can't say I have noticed any improvement on the premium side and the free side just gets worse. A ridiculous amount of ads, forces songs onto your playlist whether they're hidden or not, forces you to be online even if you've downloaded podcasts. It's ok if on premium, if it's the free version it's just the worst

Really the best app for listening to music . Totally enjoy my playlists where the songs are picked for me.The plans are somewhat feels satisfying .The UI is so simplistic and usually there are no or close to very few ads in this app

There are bugs in the app. UI is also not too friendly, and i would like u to look after these things - 1) songs in a playlist could not be arranged 2) history cannot be deleted 3) there is no option of add to queue when we search for songs 4) last played song could not be closed.

I've been using Spotify premium for years, its very easy to use and very convenient but these day it started to lagging quiet a lot and took time to open the app which makes me felt kinda frustrated about it. I happened to see other spotify users review, seems like they also face same thing like me. I hope it will be fix soon.
The last update ruined my Spotify. The song just randomly pauses for 2 seconds and starts to play again. Also, whenever I try to play a song it plays a different song from the one that I chose.

Does not work right. Does not give playback controls most of the time and requires me to restart my phone. Yes everything is up to date. Horrible experience can't believe I'm paying for this

Just download the app and it's great , it doesn't use a lot of data. I can't just find the download button.
After the update Spotify stops playing after 5 minutes and you can't even access the pause/skip buttons. Not worth paying premium for a product that doesn't work.

Lol music quality is good but the ads are just kinda annoying and when im sleeping and listening to Spotify the ads are just kinda really annoying in my phone theres no repeat for the song since i always like my music in repeat for other i dont know i guess they have the repeat button but i dont have the repeat song button so yeah i only hibe it 4 stars.

developer_response: Hey, we'd love to help get this fixed. If you haven't tried clearing the app's cache and running a clean reinstall, we'd suggest giving these a shot. If the issue persists, you can get in touch with our Customer Service so they can take a closer look. Just search ‚ÄúContact us‚Äù at support.spotify.com, or send them a DM at twitter.com/SpotifyCares.

review_description: This is the worst podcast app I have ever used. The only reason I need to use it is to listen to Armchair Expert, which is sadly an exclusive show. review_description: Not sure if this is only for my phone model but it keeps just.... closing down. I'll be playing something and then it goes quiet and when I look it's not even open. If I pick a song from a Single, it replays that song forever. I would prefer it play the song once then start radio for that song. If I have a que, and I click a song, I would like that song to play, then continue playing the items that are in the que. Instead, right now if I have a que then click a song it behaves the same as if I pressed the Next button and plays the next song in the que. It completely ignores the fact that I clicked a song that I would like to listen to.

"Spotify is trying to play" Seems like every new update makes the app more unstable. Why is this extremely high-profile app the ONLY app on my phone that still gets frozen with audio playing audio, requiring force stops? Why does the "now playing" ui disappear so frequently? Why is the gesture behavior different on songs with videos attached vs regular album art? Why is it so difficult to manage your library, especially when the automatic features are so inconsistent?

It's not awful, but there are many ways Spotify can improve to compete with rising competition. I've heard praise for the app but it's a laggy, unintuitive mess for me, especially compared to my new service TIDAL. In addition, the quality is worse and the recommendations I got on Spotify were worse for me. Another point is how little Spotify pays artists compared to other services, Spotify pays 0.003 per stream vs Quobuz's 0.04$ per stream. I hope competition improves Spotify a bit!

review_description: I very rarely leave reviews and if I do, they're almost never negative but I feel compelled in this instance, as the Spotify app has got to be the worst app I have ever used. I'm on pay as you go with no Internet access unless I'm on Wi-Fi and all I use this app for is to listen to podcasts which I download in full before my work commute. It's obvious it simply has not been designed with any consideration for a user like myself. I would go as far as to state that it's terrible for podcasts in general, regardless of how you use your phone. To give you some examples: 1. When I'm at work, my phone will connect to the work Wi-Fi. There's an internal authorisation process to let devices use Internet when on the company network. What happens is that I can't play any podcasts if my phone's Wi-Fi is on - I press the play button, but nothing happens. I have two phones, one authorised to use the network and one not and this happens on both of them. I think what is taking place in the first instance is that our heavily filtered network will not let Spotify download ads and it completely throws it out of the loop. In the second instance, I think even though my phone is well aware it has no Internet access (despite being connected to Wi-Fi), Spotify ignores this fact and still tries to download ads before playing my podcasts. So every time I'm still within the huge range of my company's Wi-Fi, I need to disable my phone's Wi-Fi before I can play my podcasts for the commute home. After they start playing, I'm free to switch the Wi-Fi back on. But this isn't even the worst that this app does. 2. Quite frequently, right when I leave my company's Wi-Fi range (it always happens at almost the exact spot down to a few meters), the podcast that is being currently played will stop, losing its progress and the next one on the list will start playing. This is especially aggravating when I'm in the car and switching back to the podcast I was listening to and then finding the exact spot where I finished is impossible to do safely without stopping somewhere. But this still isn't the worst of it. 3. Recently the app started to randomly show all of my podcasts as not downloaded or actually deleting them (I'm still not sure what exactly happens as this only occurred 3 times so far, but all instances within the last month). The first time it happened, I've noticed as I walked out the door for work that my podcasts were gone. I had to redownload them all before leaving - I'm fortunate enough to be in a position where my bosses don't care what time I clock in but otherwise I'd probably by quite irritated. The next couple times it happened as I was trying to play my podcasts on my way home from work - but in those cases, when I got home, they annoyingly again started showing as downloaded and I could play them with no problems. Mind you, I have 40GB of free storage on my phone. And then there's the absolutely shockingly unusable and ugly interface (but I suppose it does fit the terrible Spotify logo). Manually removing a downloaded podcast from my playlist and downloads is an unintuitive multi-step process. I can't even change the order my podcasts will play in once they're on my playlist. I couldn't find a way to loop the playlist either, so if the last episode on your playlist is the first one you'll want to play, then you'll have to manually start the list from the top once it finishes. It can be supper annoying if this happens when you're on a motorway. It's like whoever created this app hasn't actually used it. It just blows my mind that a company as big as Spotify can't make an app that works, is usable and doesn't look like it was designed in Excel (actually, you can do much prettier things in Excel than that).
Stops playing music randomly, UI breaks often, and "Randomize" only plays 20 song loops in my 300 song playlist.

This app has literally become pathetic. I must say that I began with a good experience a few years ago but today I feel that this app has become so pathetic that I don't even feel like using it. Best music streaming app in the market. The music quality is good and their music recommendations are just frickin awesome. Their app UI is the best(no competition in that segment) and easy to use. Their music library is up to date. But too many ads in free version makes it quite annoying tbh. The premium version of it is too good and worth the money. Overall best app in the segment.
Looking for a music app that will complement your music listening audiophile equipment? Spotify is the place to be. Great music app. I heard they are working on Hi-Res, Hi-Fi settings, how exciting!
Quite good, not perfect but the redeeming factor over youtube music would have to be that you dont have to pay to play music with your screen off or on other windows. Would recommend.

Stuttering playback The music or podcast keeps pausing and playing back. It doesn't matter if it's cellular network or WiFi. Even if I download songs or podcasts still happens. Really really annoying and it ruins completely the experience. I'm not sure if it's a problem with my phone or a bug with the app.

After 4 years of being a subscriber, what else can I say: the best music streaming service out there. Only note: I wish the UI would be a bit more intuitive, but the app pretty much alway had this problem and it did greatly improve.

Overall, I would still rate this app at #2 or #3 as my all time favorite. Primarily due to the UI. I just have never liked it when compared to Rhapsody's (now Napster). Pandora and Spotify are about equal imo. Pandora still has the better long-term retention of playlists, with mine dating before the housing collapse 2008-9.

i use Spotify premium a lot and am quite happy with it, when it works, i really like the song radio. sadly, way to often the app needs 3 minutes to open i think its connected to the amount of songs i downloaded. while using it you just experience way to often how inefficient it is coded. an app like Spotify should run on a brick. but it even bugs and lags on a decent phone. i constantly have to reinstall it and eh.

Inconsistent UI when playing music, sometimes shuffle button is hidden. All should be consistent between iOS and Android when it comes to UI placement. Not well optimised when it comes to battery usage.

Don't get my wrong this app is amazing but recently been having a few faults with the like button being very glitchy and also weirdly the app constantly been asking for my bank details recently when without fail I always pay on time every single month!

developer_response: Hey, thanks for the feedback! We'd suggest heading over to http://community.spotify.com > Ideas to look for relevant suggestions that you can vote for or create a new one. Other users can then show support by voting for the idea. Hope this helps.

review_description: The UI, song recommendations, and podcast experience is fantastic. My only gripe is that "Hey Spotify" is inconsistent and at times inaccurate.

It's one of the best music-streaming applications out there. Clean interface, pleasing to the eye, high quality audio and loads of features. And if you ever have a problem, their twitter @SpotifyCares is really quick to reply to your problems. Overall really smooth and flawless experience.

Been using since 2015. Overall the experience is pretty good. However, would like to see some quirks ironed out, i.e the shuffle sometimes plays same songs over and over in a playlist and I have to manually select other songs to make it play the whole playlist. Bit of an inconvenience on road/during work.
Lyrics. Lyrics. Lyrics. It would be better if there was a button to see the lyrics. I keep skuiling when I wanna check if the song has lyrics and it's quite inconvenient

The fact I have to get premium just to skip songs is absurd. I would also like it if I could press on my playlist and pick the song I wanna listen to first instead of clicking the play button and having it shuffled to a song I don't feel like listening to.

App crashes almost every time I try to use it. Some songs just stay mute no matter what. The content is great but technical issues ruin it for me completely. Seeing how there are numerous reviews reporting the same issue I'm surprised that nothing's being done about it.

Numerous UI issues. Ads cause some podcasts to restart from the beginning. Customer support is terrible even for premium subscribers. What prompted me to finally write this review was opening the app and seeing a giant pop-up of propaganda regarding midterm elections. No, I don't need your advice on voting, Spotify.
The apple version of this app is superior. This app has no lock screen scrolling or quick queue add via sliding the song left. The home screen is hard to navigate since the most recent update.

I'm really disappointed, but I guess you can't trust companies.

developer_response: Hey! These are part of our free service on mobile. You can replace the songs we add by following the steps under "Suggested tracks" at https://support.spotify.com/using_spotify/playlists/create-a-playlist. Playlists without the Shuffle icon are available to pick and play - you can play them in any order and skip tracks as much as you like.

review_description: I love house/techno/classic dance. I had Apple music. Spotify has way more variety than Apple. I prefer Spotify UI also. Spotify doesn't have all the music that is present on YouTube.

I don't know what I would have done without spotify. My day starts with spotify and ends with spotify. I created my own playlist so I could listen to my own preferred kind of music. Spotify is a blessing in disguise as it entertains me with over a million songs and will always be in my life for as long as I live..........

I used to like this app earlier. However, now it is just frustrating because it interrupts too much with its ads that it ruins the whole music listening experience. It forces continuously to buy premium and many times the ads are so long that it ruins my mood to listen before even listening to any song.
The greatest music streaming app; I've used apple music, Pandora, etc but this one has the best user friendly UI, great audio quality, multi-streaming options. Take my money please

this sucks. the front page has been over-simplified. instead of a grid of recent listens and suggestions, there are now ONLY recommendations in overbearing rectangles. I prefer to listen to spotify instead of the radio. I'm able to choose music that I prefer to listen to, only the ads are a bit of a nuisance, when I can't afford premium at the moment.

Large searchable catalog. You can create sharable playlist and simply add songs to your custom stations that you can also share. Very reliable and affordable and I have been finding more edited song versions. Great UI, Platform, App.

Ill look up a song,and then when i tap the play button ill get an entirely different song,not only that,but after an ad,your told you get 30 minutes of uninterrupted listening,this is not true,because after that ad appeared,after experiencing the previously mentioned "entirely different song" problem, I went to another song only to get another 30 second ad,promising me the same 30 minutes ad free. I HATE the new forced shuffle play button. I want to listen to albums in the song order intended by the artist. They are making this more difficult than it should be by not having a standard Play button.

Uses huge amounts of data. It should use WIFI connection to preload the songs, but it doesn't. It's only buffering a few seconds. Total waste of mobile data. I can't download all the songs and albums onto the phone. It's also huge amounts of data clogging up my phone then. They really need to come up with something better. UI hasn't changed for years and it's not that great. Yet, nobody seems to care and no improvement in sight.

Horrible syncing with google home. And it sometimes restarts playlist after going in the app. Also the music player appears in quick settings even after closing the app, and there's no way to close it.
It fails more and more with each update. Doesn't sync properly with the Windows app, the Shuffle Play button for playlists should have the option to change the behaviour from Settings.

You're gonna listen to our podcasts and you're gonna like it! So muched forced content onto the home page is just a jumbled mess. Not to mention it's basically ruined the Android Auto experience. So I can subscribe via someone's Patreon and add the RSS feed. Spotify doesn't want you going outside of them though.

Needs to stop pushing podcasts on people. I don't care about podcasts, I don't want recommendations for them. Before i paid for it had it for 3 months no problem..as soon as i started to pay 1 day my account hack 1 week later cant play the songs..always crash and dont allow me play the songs what are we paying for a service that always cant do what it was designed for..

review_description: Can't cancel the paid version unless you are on a web browser. It messes up your playlists, constantly. The drive mode feature enables itself and is counterintuitive. I hate the app.

I love this app for music the only thing that sucks is some music from big artist isnt on there an then when u pay ur bill in the middle of the month it wants your payment again the beginning of the following month instead of waiting the 30 days its suppose to charge u i do love it tho thats why i gave it 5 stars theres just a couple tweeks they need to fix but ive been usuing it for years if y'all want a good music app this is it

The best one always. When I installed and started listening it's the best app compared to other ones. Initially without premium the ads were pretty frequent and quite disturbing. When I subscribed to the premium it was so great that everyday we would get our daily mixes and filtered podcasts daywise according to our followed lists. I would gladly recommend this app for music being a music lover‚ù§Ô∏è! go for it & enjoy the musicüéµ

I probably have listened to more ads than songs by the time Im writing this. I wish this was my only complain, sadly the app keeps breaking when I try to open it 90% of the time it will say I have no internet connection when I clearly do and when I clearly can open Youtube or anything else that requires internet seconds later and everything will be fine. The app used to have a feature that would allow you to listen to an ad to gain 30 minutes of ad free listening time but that is long gone.

I love it it's great and has most songs on it I have been using it for 3 years now however not all songs are on here and the songs in different languages like Japanese I can't search it cuz it's in those letter it doesn't translate the title to my language which is bad and you do get ads quite often but besides that it is really good as you can listen to podcasts as well as songs and you can make play lists and at the end of the year it shows you you most listened to song and stuff so yeah
Good. But web version doesn't work fine. Suddenly stop playing the song after sometime. We have to revisit the page and click on play button.
I liked it better before when you had the back button. Instead you put the like button there. If I didn't like the song I wouldn't have put it on my playlist...common sense.
Worst layout and design for music app I have ever seen. Apple music is so much better and has more of a range of songs. How bout you resign your app.

Absolutely garbage interface. I have premium, theres no skip/rewind track buttons, continues to be stuck on the last podcast I listened to weeks ago. Automatically starts plays what ever I last listened to without hitting play. Music/podcast randomly stop playing weather I'm wearing earbud, listening there's blue tooth speaker, in the car. Definitely canceling. COMPLETE GARBAGE, aside from actual content. Which you basically can't listen to because the app is garbage..

The app has been lagging so much for months now I'm basically unable to use it. It takes a long time to open, not to mention load anything. Playing any playlist is impossible if I want to do quickly (even if I have them downloaded). I have the premium plan and I can't even use it properly.

Much more enticing and Beautiful graphics are possible...as long as you're at it...maybe take some hints from Guardians of the Galaxy 2, and Fantasia....you don't have to lose clear business communications in making the visuals irresistibly immersive like great music! MAKE IT A DESTINATION!!!

I've keep on continuing subscriptions for this app (Premium Duo) as I have no problem using it. Besides the good and trendy music listening, I still can enjoy the music in background while getting busy with other apps. I highly recommended to use high-tech in ear wireless headphone to experience digital sound clarity and high bass music. It's addictive. Thank you.

Suggestion algorithm is not good as it should be and absolutely need to search for good songs and create playlists manually. Well, cloud features are pretty good. Another feature that is lacking is the equalizer as a built in feature.

Great app but they keep updating it just to remove features, rearrange the ui (making it worse) and break things. I turned it on today just to see that my "liked songs" playlist of 3300 songs had been undownloaded for no reason, and when trying to redownload it only downloads 1800 of them for some reason.

Congratulations to Spotify for ruining a perfectly good app with your money grabbing BS forcing people to pay so they are able to listen to their own playlist not on shuffle and select which songs they want to listen to from their own playlist is ridiculous money hungry bull you have taken what was until recently a wonderful app and turned it into absolute garbage you should absolutely be ashamed of yourself and either get rid of this abomination and that was once a good application or return it

Spotify India has aggressively tuned advertisements that keeps asking to upgrade to premium account, which sounds like a threat. I have slowly started to avoid Spotify. If you're going to ruin a user's mood by constantly pushing to get the premium account, why even bother having a free app then?
Please put the play button back in the middle of the screen. Too difficult to reach in the far right side for this left-handed operator, and it's too small.

It's quite irritating when they have all these feature but not on all phone, i don't even have the lyrics feature nor the blend percentage feature. I mean why bother to include this feature at all when some people can't enjoyed it, if it's true that all of these feature are still in development, then why not put it in the beta program rather than just random people get these feature.

Great app and the music selection is cool, but I don't like the fact that in a gospel mix, other genre of music gets to show up frequently. It ruins the whole essence of the mix. But aside this, I'm enjoying every bit of the app

Why are there still no brighter mode options? Also, how come downloading individual songs are still a hassle with playlists and all. I should be able to retain all songs from downloaded playlists even if the songs on the playlist change. Y'all really should do better. We want a download button next to the 3 dots for options for each individual song

Spotify is a digital music, podcast, and video service that gives you access to millions of songs and other content from creators all over the world. Basic functions such as playing music are totally free, but you can also choose to upgrade to Spotify Premium. ... Build collections of music and podcasts. And more! You can try it and i am 100% sure you will love itüñ§üñ§üñ§üñ§üíöüíöüíöüíö

[Original Rating: ****]Installed recently, liking the experience so far. Great library management features, well laid out UI and excellent recommendations. Will update review after using for 6 months or so. Edit 1: Why am I seeing Hindi songs in my home screen suggestions, when I have not selected Hindi in my languages? I don't even have the option to remove it. *** now.

ok the UI is top notch. the variety of songs is exciting. but I always have trouble with the downloading and offline listening. I have to open up the app everyday to get all my songs downloaded. the offline listening is a pain to deal with. it says that it'll keep the songs for 29 days without wifi connection but somehow logs me out of the app and I have to download them all over again! my auto-updates are on, the app IS up to date always... and yet! fix this spotify!
Buggy. Scrolling through playlists or podcast episodes is almost impossible. User interface is unintuitive and constantly changing.

The music is good but the ad for joining premium is too irritating. Almost after each song the come and ruin the mood they are so frequent i remember the script of the ad more than the songs. And the app is working super slow it takes more than 10 mins to load... Really a dumb app

I love the app and everything but in the last update they took out the back button on the lock screen mini player to out the like button. I know I can swipe down to expand the mini player but I honestly think it was fine before. This is just uncomfortable and I wouldn't have updated if I knew this would happen.

I normally just go to my liked songs and hit shuffle. internet was beinf slow and my phone was saying its full. after a bit i find the notification sayinh im downloading something and it turns out there is this little download songs button that requires no verification. my phone was trying to download all 1200 songs on my list. please fix. i know its impossible to get ahold of the company unless i get some petition signed but its worth a shot

- no way to listen to multiple playlists - weird, unintuitive operations (playlist ordering is hidden away like /that/?) - no play all my music - no separation between podcasts & music - weird & useless lyrics thingy - no gestures to open/close player, but to skip songs??? - confusing queues (why are there two?) - slow animation on every menu, would be less of a problem if stuff like liking weren't hidden away in there - no indications on where there are menus - no full list of an artists songs

Spotify is the only music source I use to listen to a wide variety of songs and podcasts. The monthly fee for my family plan is extremely 5reasonable. I've discovered so many new artist using Spotify's weekly playlists that I quit counting a long time ago.

Get rid of the ability of having ads every two or one song its annoying and why did you remove the watch 30 minutes of unnaruptive listening? Quit trying to be greedy and shove ads down our thoughts just so we can buy premium and some can't afford or have a credit card to buy premium >:( bring back unnaruptive listening I rather listen to one ad for 30 mins of no stupid ads. Thanks!

I love Spotify, but I hate the UI. I should be able to search for an artist and see a list of their songs, not give songs and then having to look through each album. It really is a terrible UI and is by far the worst thing about the app. It also crashes when swiping through podcasts. Considering this is a paid subscription service I expect better.

It was awesome then started noticing that certain songs I didn't like kept reappearing. The don't like button was almost never there lately. Why pay for something that used to be great but no longer is.

I don't understand why I can't set an established podcast from oldest to newest without it refreshing to not only playing it from the newest first, but if I do get the sort by button to stick, it will not remain in sequential order when I'm scrolling to find an older episode on my phone that I have not heard yet. So there are probably 200 episodes of history and true crime that I can't experience without figuring out a workaround. And how can I be sure that I won't have this with premium too üëé

The most ghetto/janky app out there. Podcast episodes play in no particular order, IF they even play at all. Queue is also erratic. All in all this is a dangerous app to drive with because it is so distracting and doesn't fulfill the basic task it was designed to do, which is PLAY.

The app was great at start with very good songs and suggestions, however lately the autoplay button is not working at all although the function is on in the settings. The adds have increased drastically and the app stops after playing 1 song (u can't even press the next button) I've done everything (reinstalled,cleared cache, switched the autoplay button on and off) still the function is not working. Please look into it carefully becoz this is the 2nd time in 2 days when Im reinstalling the app.

I use premium and the experience is superb. Can listen to it with or without wifi(for downloaded songs). They even specially create playlists for me every week :), helps me explore songs! (only thing is that when using through safari, it will stop after one song and you will have manually press for it to continue, quite irritating but the in app experience is amazing)

I don't know what update they put in this, but its trash. I try searching songs and get the Playlist of the song and not the actual song. My liked playlist has a play button that lets you listen to PART of the song. NOT THE WHOLE ONE. I can't listen to the ones I want T_T. Please fix it, its annoying.

Cash grabbing criminal organisation with poor versions of songs. Paid for a year, couldn't download music or cancel subscription. If you want to complain they will force other methods and still steal ur money. YouTube music is significantly better. Spotify is the MySpace equivalent of fb. Null and void. I want my $200 back WITHOUT the legal or administrative loops u force the customer's through

Uninstalled this app as it has serious battery drain issue with Samsung One UI. When you use Spotify songs as alarm tones it drains battery drastically. I've double checked this issue with other one UI users and the issue does exist.

I love Spotufy and have been using it for quite a while. However, if you have the free version- you get ads after every two or three songs and it's really annoying as it's two thirty-minute, unskippable ads.

Spotify is good if you have premium, which is quite expensive, however the benefits may be worth it for you since the ability to have a large selection of music on your phone ad free and downloadable is very nice. That privelidge just comes at a relatively high price.

The app is rly great but the annoying f**king ads is ruining it, Ik you need funds but at this point it is soo irritating that people are creating new apk clients for this and maybe it'll be the dawn of spotify if this keeps going on..just idk man try to cool it down a bit and the Spotify premium forced ads are Just makes me want to kill myself sometimes and it greatly affects the listener's experience and they sought out diff alternatives.

Absolutely fantastic. Yes there are ads, but thats every free game that requires wifi. Don't like ads? Buy premium! I would recommend this to anybody who doesn't have it. If I could rate 6 stars, I would.
Where tf is the repeat button? Not to mention they add irrelevant songs to my playlist. And when I listen to my playlist they don't play the right song. Would never recommend. Don't get it trust me.
My favorite music app I use. All the effects are simple and easy to use, and I love the quilty options for the downloads. Keep it up Spotifyü§ô

The new update has gotten rid of the previous song button and replaced it with the heart button - to go back to the start of whatever you're listening to, you must unlock your phone, go into the app and do it from there. I don't understand why they thought this was a good idea, but makes an otherwise decent app very frustrating to use. Bring back the back button!

I dont quite know what the problem is but I literqlly just cant download spotify on my phone no matter what i have it on my laptop and it works perfectly fine but it just wont let me download the app for some reason I've tried so many times and I waited a couple of days in between each time and it still wont let me I dont know why

I recently changed my review to a one-star because after months of paying for premium I'm still listening to ads on podcast your platform does not seem to save my place correctly a lot of the times you need more updates and you need to quit asking people for money if you're going to put five or more ads in a podcast it's a bit ridiculous

Whatever they did with the new update ruined the app. It stops playing randomly, doesn't show the correct song playing on the app, doesn't provide media controls in the notification bar like before, and sends a "Spotify connections" notification 3 times every hour or so.

Irony inside : The app UI is from the 80' I think. I doubt there's any good UI/UX designer in the team. Countless clicks to reach the most basic and rudimentary functions that exist in the simplest music players for decades. I'm not even talking about the awful algorithm that suggests musical genres that are hundreds of miles away from what I listen to. I've been listening to Black metal for years in premium Spotify and the algorithm suggests Bible and awful pop music LOL

why did yall take away the download all songs from a playlist button. why edit: I'm gonna give 1 star because I don't understand why you have to limit free users to this degree. I have premium now but I didn't use this app for a very long time when my last premium expired because it's impossible to use w a free account. You can't even pick through songs in an album?? You guys used to be cool a few years ago. also my question still stands: WHY DID YALL TAKE AWAY THE DOWNLOAD ALL BUTTON YOU---

I was very enjoyed spotify before the update st July 2021. I know i just have a free acount, but this disgusting, I can't choose any other music, the play button will play shuffle of any other songs. If I search songs the app not show songs list again and changed with artist album I don't like it, i will remove spotify it's not my favourite again.
Sort by time button takes three taps before it works on podcasts. It will flip first but then revert back and you have to try again.

The "Liked" button is too close to the Play/Pause button, causing me to remove songs from my Liked songs accidentally. There's not even a confirmation like: "Are you sure you want to remove this song?" It just removes it right away.

Often won't start, requires restarting phone to work (even then you have to log off then log back in, to be told you have no internet connection, eventually it goes online then it seems to re-download all previously downloaded music) clearing cache and force start don't help. Then after a couple of days it won't start again. This is 2021 surely it should just work and not require so much user intervention, I don't have these sorts of problems with Google Podcasts (and thats free of charge).
Probably the worst UI of any music app. Songs get deleted at random and thus need to be re-downloaded, Interface just bugs out sometimes, long loading screens, etc

Love the app, but the most recent update that removed the rewind button in the lock screen player is extremely frustrating, and I'm sure I'm not the only one who feels this way. The like button is useless in this mini player, we benefited much more from the rewind button. Please bring it back...

1million songs in your pocket. I have used premium service for almost 3years. Really enjoy it. The quality of the sound can be set in settings and if you have a good set of earphones, it's worth the listen. Interface could be more intuitive and equaliser settings not so difficult to set.

I love to listen to my music here but I just got 6 ads in a row trying to listen to a playlist. As soon as I clicked the play button on my playlist I got 6 ads back to back. I understand why there are ads but really 6 ads just to finally hear my music. That is ridiculous. But sadly it's not the first time that this has happened to me nor will it be my last.

This is an easy and intuitive App to use. I love that it can stream in very High Quality, as I have no data restrictions. The difference is clear. I don't even look at Pandora anymore. Spotify has earned it's top position in my opinion. üëçüèªüòéüëçüèª

For the amount of money this app makes... We deserve better. But maybe it's because i use Android still disappointed... The layout is ugly and seems lazy... And it could be so much better... Ugh... Mainly had no issues but also... I would prefere something intuitive.... 3 stars that's all you get. Also I'm not in the car... That message always pops up and it's anoying.... As hell
Changed back to 5 stars. The UI as it is now is useful, informative and not buggy. A lot more enjoyable experience!

The update ruined the app. Let people police themselves when it comes to driving mode. You can't even switch out of it once it's on driving mode!? It's really ruined Spotify for me. They need to switch back and focus on paying their artists instead of ruining the app.

Great selection of music, comedy and podcasts. Sound sucks big time no matter how many people have given advice how to tweak settings. Also not very intuitive when it comes to predicting what you like to listen to & suggestions. Needs more work.

I still use the regular unpaid version and most of the time I love it, however I've actually listened to adverts for well over 5 minutes now, I stopped counting after the 10th one and couldnt quite believe what I was hearing. It doesn't make me want to get premium, I'd rather go elsewhere to get my songs if your advertising is constant and unpleasant.

I was forced to switch to Spotify due to my favorite parcast podcasts only playing on here now. I can't figure out how to not the episode automatically go to the next. Turning off the autoplay button didn't work. The only reason I'm giving Spotify 5 stars and not 4 is because I find it soooo awesome that the podcasts episodes come with transcripts. That's something that my old podcast app didn't do. I had to download another app to accommodate this shortcoming but w/Spotify I don't need it üòä

The free app is terrible so you almost need to buy the premium. This app sucks it autoplays over anything else you play no matter what if Bluetooth is linked it plays Spotify. THEY PUT ADDS IN A PODCAST THAT WAS SPECIFICALLY MADE FOR ZERO ADDS abs it ruins the flow of the podcast
I've been using Spotify for years and really enjoy it. I only wish they would bring back the dislike button, so you wouldn't have to keep skipping songs you don't like.

You got one new build to fix it. I'm not going to tell you what's wrong because I know that you know that app it's basically broken. Fix it or you will lose a customer and I'm taking all my friends with me. You got one build to do it and I'm waiting like millions of other paying customers who pay for an app and service that isn't working. I have to power cycle my phone just to get it to work again for a little while and have the best phone money can buy. It's the broken app.

Current bugs: current position in podcast is grossly wrong, Spotify starts playing on its own anytime I get a notification, bug reporting system is non-existent. The UI updates are all awful, it's like they want you to hate using the app.
I can't complain too much because their UI is pleasant to use and the music they have available is stunning. But holy heck, why does it keep pausing seemingly at random. I don't understand.

There are no visible updates required but Spotify keeps crashing. The display won't change from the first song I play, and if I skip 3 songs the songs stop playing all together then I have to restart my whole phone. It's super annoying considering how much we have to pay for this

This was easily my favorite paid app, love all the options. Since I got a Samsung Galaxy S20 Ultra, the app is basically unusable. I'm very close to canceling my Premium and finding a new music app. No one can give me any answers and it's quite frustrating. Beware.
I paid for three months but it didn't show the lyrics button. I already uninstalled it like three times but it didn't work. It's very disappointing. Please fix it!

Spotify isn't the worst ever, however it depends on what you are listening on. On phones, you can only shuffle but on tablets, you can swipe and pick songs without paying. The buttons are very annoyingly small and the ads are starting to become a lot more unnecessary and often.
Music is good but the new UI has taken away so many features and is utterly useless, please for the love of god either change it back or make it useful.

I really only used this app for podcasts because it never really cut it for music for me (even with a free trial once upon a time), but now I have to use it for JRE. BRUH, this player will literally interrupt with 4 Ads and then restart the podcast for no reason. Sometimes it'll just skip to the next podcast for no reason. Not only was this a mediocre platform when I CHOSE to try to use it, but it is an utter disappointment as something I have to use. There are far better designed platforms.

Junk podcast app. PAID PREMIUM still has ads before and during podcasts and app is unusable with ANY vpn, app REQUIRES location access. Offline mode requires you to disable vpn and download, then you must disable Offline mode every 2 days to re-sync or all you downloaded stuff is inaccessible. JUNK! I have tried the tech department and forums. No good solutions available.

I've been using this app since 2 years the number one issue ive been dealing with is when I want to go back to a certain song or press the reverse button it like won't let me. And 2, back then we get to choose any song we want and when I make a playlist I press a song I want and it only gives me seconds of the song and boom no more and I certainly always have to use shuffle play. But I'm just asking Is it because of the device I'm using???
Only can go skip forward/pause/like songs when phone is closed now. Just add 4 buttons if u really wanted to add the ability to like songs, don't remove skipping to a previous song

It's fast to load, has a good UI and huge library but is completely let down by the infuriating, useless shuffle feature. It just doesn't work. Playlists will have 10+ hours of music but you'll only ever hear the first 100 tracks of each, then it starts over. A 30 minute pause will reset the list. Come back from lunch and bam! the same first tracks, same order. Forums online will show you that it's been years and no acknowledgement by devs, just bs and useless non-fixes. Use YouTube music

App constantly stops and quits. Then the app begins the podcast i was listening to in random places. Sometimes it restarts the podcast from the beginning or starts playing another random episode. Unbearable. The worst.

Love it but it does have an annoying tendency to "undownload" album and playlists I have downloaded as well as quite often tell me there is no internet connection when there is...and when it does this I can't access any music downloaded or otherwise. Apart from that I love it...
It's a great music streaming app, the ads are quite irritatating, but they aren't as frequent as I thought they'd be. But over all very happy with the app.

I genuinely feel like im being made to go premium. Free ver is supposed to shuffle songs, but in actuality it doesn't shuffle in the word's proper sense at all. Most of the time i 'shuffle' liked songs, the app keeps replaying a tiny fraction of the playlist to the point i get utterly bored of them, and totally overlooks the newly added ones.
The new app is extremely unintuitive and hard to use. I want my music listening to be quick and simple. Not this clunky Spotify. I Uninstalled after being a user for many years.

My music collection is far better and complete than spotify. Also, it's quite heavy to load when using my mobile data. It consumes my phone storage. In totality, I like the concept of spotify but it needs improvement and that's I think in far future. Well, the only thing that's constant is change, right?
When opening the app from the home screen songs will automatically skip without touching the player widget or skip buttons. Podcasts will not save their place when I exit the app.
Premium user. Old Spotify was better... Songs keep getting removed and the updated layout is not near as user friendly. Also having issues with music continuing to play after I shut my screen off.
Usually a great app, but recently the lock controlls don't have a "play previous" button. It has the favourite heart there instead which is extremely irritating.

I don't know who's idea it was to change the restart song button into a like song button but it doesn't matter. PLEASE CHANGE IT BACK! They have a tendency to ruin your mood while you play song to soothen by giving constant adds literally every time you open the app, change the song and even after clicking the no thanks option below the add and the special service add for telling that another add is gonna come really man it sucks. I've used Spotify for years and it's been great. But PLEASE will you stop doing completely pointless updates. The worst one yet is changing the skip back button on the lock screen to a "like" button. It's a really good app for music lovers like me.But as a tablet user which has just 16GB space it's quite difficult to have Spotify as it takes too much space.It already has taken over more than 1.5 GB of my space.So I request you to reduce the space taken over by Spotify when you're at leisure.I would give five stars if my Spotify space would be lower than 700MB.(I also know of Spotify lite but it's not possible for me to make it into landscape.So please make it possible to rotate my screen)

Ruined the app I can no longer just play a song I want it makes me auto shuffle I can't search up a song and listen to it without the song being on a different playlist and the app automatically added songs to my playlist I don't want on there

This app has become truly awful for the last few months for me. I can no longer listen to my downloaded podcasts offline no matter what I do. Another thing is that it keeps constantly updating/re-downloading files I already have, just so they can update their ads. Spotify could be so helpful in spreading wisdom via free podcast episodes, but their stupid/greedy decisions and/or lack of bug fixing ruin this potential.

What's with this new interface? It's a mess, and definitely not user friendly. Pls just... Go back to what it was before. Instead of filters, just leave the separate tabs. It's easier and better that way EDIT: why would we need the "like" button instead of the one to go back to the previous song? Seriously...

If a podcast has more than 100 episodes the app will only ever let you see the first or last 100 episodes no matter what you do, and if you listen to 100 it just restarts at 1 instead of continuing to 101. Also sometimes when i have no data or internet connection it won't play downloaded music.
Terrible new UI Sometimes the app freeze and still play music so have to force close it by going to the system settings.. I cannot believe I pay ¬£9.99 for sucha terrible music steaming app

Just using a months free trial and works great but i'll only be taking up a subcription if they bring out c.d. lossless as the quality isn't quite there for me, untill they do (if?) I'll stick with qobuz.

Spotify is great but everytime i want a song it wont let me play it and it will glitch and ive checked my data? This is my issue that is quite annoying also when i want to add a song it shall not let me play the song i added and it will do it randomly so im sorry but 2 stars.
Please, add option to get back "Previous track" button to minimized version of player in notifications. Last update changed it to like button, which i don't use

Think twice before using: buggy and unreliable app for which they should offer discounts on subscription. It is very good but there is a glich in app when we connect to wireless headphones , and once we listen a song and then if get out completely of the app and then if we use headphone buttons then the song runs without opening app and it is a glich i hope you understood it and definitely try it once
Wonderful selection of music to suite all ages. On or Off line, you can listen to any track you want or a selection of tracks or pod casts

Wth happened to this app? I used to be able to sort my music with the click of a button, it used to work flawlessly. I have had the app for years and now I cancelled my subscription. I loved this app but features get taken away so why pay for it or use it.

fine for most part. but it updates way too often and they never bother saying what you're downloading in the app store. don't forget to manually disable camera permission, why is that necessary? and it always tells me I can watch a video ad for 30 minutes of ad free music but it stopped showing me a "watch video" button years ago so it just sits in silence waiting for me to respond without giving me a way to respond, then plays their regular audio ad. feels on purpose to worsen free version

The Spotify/Mobile App is a nightmare of poor design. Just search for users who simply want to a play an album in the order it is in, and you will find hundreds if not thousands of complaints going back years. One huge button that says, "Shuffle Play" and no intuitive way to play it in order. What's worse is even if you do know to click the first song in the list, it still does not work if you still songs queued as it reverts to shuffle after the first song. As an IT professional of 35 years' experience, including UI design, this is simply unacceptable. Many answers give workarounds such as "go to Desktop app" ... guess what, not everyone has a Desktop app, and giving users "workarounds" for a years old issue is NOT a solution.

I'm genuinely curious why every six months this app is redesigned to be 10% more difficult to use and introduce more bugs. Can I just set the default view not to be every single album and playlist in my library? I've made playlists for a reason, make them easy to access again.
