Very buggy recently. Most frustratingly, it keeps losing track of playback; music plays but the playback time and control buttons get stuck. Also frequently stops playing for no reason.

The app was good. Until two updates ago. Before, I had one search bar in my desktop app. When I key in a word, media containing those words populate the screen. Under the songs category, media from my local drive are shown first and then those from the web. This works for me since my music is a hybrid of local songs and songs from the web. I can directly go ahead and add the local media to a playlist directly from the search results. Now that doesn't happen anymore. Only media from the web are shown in search results. You have to open the Local Files folder to search for local songs., which is a hassle. Is there a way to go back to that UI? Also, in my Samsung Galaxy Note 10+, some weird things happen. At times, the notification bar would show two songs playing on Spotify. One is the song currently playing while the other is a stating media that's always there. I have to swipe twice to remove the notification. And the problem persists until the next time I restart my phone. It doesn't happen in my Vivo, by the way.

As with everyone else who has left 1 star reviews recently, the latest update causes random freezes. The 'now playing' window breaks and a device restart is required to get it running. Not only that, Spotify takes an age to open up downloaded songs if your connection is slow. Come on Spotify, sort it out!

I have a Galaxy F 62 device running on Android 11 One ui 3.1 on the top of it. After 24 hrs my offline music on app gets deleted automatically. I did everything to mitigate the issue like 1. Clearing the app from battery or storage optimizations. 2. Uninstalling and installing it again from Play store. But nothing seems to work. I think this problem is from your side. Please help.

After the last update the app got super squirrely on my s21 ultra. Bluetooth connectivity issues, not pausing, continuing to play after Bluetooth disconnects. I've tried uninstalling and reinstalling, restarting my phone, updating all the other apps - nothing helps! It was great and super stable before.

For a second, Spotify had a design change today and I'm sure I didn't dream it but it was awesome but then it disappeared so I decides to update the app thinking that was it but the cool design is gone. Dafuq?

New update has ruined the app. Downloaded content to play offline- now need internet to play. All music, podcasts, artists etc is moved into 1 list making it harder to navigate. App like to shut off regularly in the middle if using it. What's the point of paying for premium when the quality is dropping? I've been a premium member for years, with the offline mode being what I mainly want it for. Now I download it to listen offline, but it won't play past a few seconds without internet.

The update is buggy. The playback strip at the bottom fails to update and so does not correspond to what is actually playing. And no, a 'quick' reinstall - three in fact - didn't work, and failed to find my data. Uninstalling and moving on. Lucky I didn't upgrade to premium

Anyone else having an issue with this being complete garbage? It crashes about every 30 seconds, pauses for no reason. Says its playing one podcast but its actually another. Play and pause button seems to be frozen and even if I close the app it still says its playing.

Love Spotify, but they refuse to add an option to make 'explicit' (read original) versions of songs the standard (restrict ruined radio edits) even though the community routinely asks for it, and they have a toggle for the opposite. As a non parent and music lover, this single handedly is sending me to literally any other music player.
The latest update has some definite issues. The screen doesn't match up with what is playing and it stops playing randomly which is quite annoying.

I enjoyed setting my own playlist finding phones that I haven't heard and quite a long time so many variety you have to choose from is there a way that I can get this without having to renew my prescription every month how about you just run until I stop it that's what I like that's what I would enjoy

Everything is great. Although thwre is one little problem that is concerning me. Whenever I turn my Redmi phone into dark mode, the play/pause button becomes invisible. I know this is not a big deal, but it is kinda annoying for me. Would be glad if you could fix that.

The new update has just completely borked the app, I have limited internet connection where I work and rely heavily on downloads and the offline mode. Half of my playlists will error out or be unplayable after downloading and being turned offline and podcasts that were listed and worked the one day will suddenly all list June 1969 as if they didn't exist and become inaccessible until I'm able to go online again. The new redesign has also made the whole app incredibly slow with loading

Last update ruined the app for me, in podcast categories the true crime is basically empty only shows 4 shows,so now you don't see anything newly available and to find something you have to search through other categories or specifically type in what your looking for into the search,also have problems with the app freezing,not playing stuff,not being able to switch track etc.

Great app for Android Update 5/26/21: using Spotify app on Samsung galaxy note ultra 20 running Android. App stops playing podcast at random times. The "now playing" bar at bottom of the screen shows inaccurate podcast title and is intermittently non-functional (pause/play buttons).

Worst experience. I couldn't even search a song. Whenever the search button is pressed, it starrs showing "No internet connection" and this is when there IS high speed network connection. Even though it shows "No internet connection", it resumes the previous song and even the liked songs.

The latest update is very unreliable. It starts playing when I disconnect from Bluetooth which is annoying when I get out of the car and have to kill the app. The recent UI change is terrible for getting to what you want in your library.

Love Spotify but this new update is awful. Won't show what's currently playing, can't pause or skip or quite literally do anything. The only way to stop what I have playing is to close the app completely. This needs to be addressed by Spotify very soon, its been a week and I'm almost ready to go back to Pandora ü§Æ

Very disappointing. I can not play songs from playlist when I click on a play button it plays a preview of song. But I can not play songs as per my choice from playlists. However working on pc and tv apps. Hope this is fixed soon. Region. Pakistan

I can't log into my account, no matter how much I try, it shows my password is incorrect. And when i tap in the link button sent on my email - It shows the link has expired already within few moments. This has been happening for more than a month. Help! Edit - I had to approach their support. They told me my account was blocked due to no valid reason! I had to create a Whole NEW account, lost all my playlists and songs.

It's always slow to do what I want it to do. Lately it will show a different title then the song I'm on. It doesn't automatically update even though I have it set to automatic. It's still a great app but apps like YouTube music could quickly make spotify null

Literally unistalling this. You've totally ruined the user interface with these updates. Why have you made it harder to use. Do you want less subscribers because your going the right way about it. Why am I suddenly following a bunch of artists because i may have listened to a song once. Why am I following any artists? shouldn't I be able to decide if I want to follow someone?!. why am i now not able to delete playlist without just touching it?. Seriously pissed and removing this off my phone.

The new version has so many issues. Can't stop and start from the bar in the notifications, it doesn't accurately show what is playing in the bar either. Same thing with currently playing in the app. Thats it for bugs but the redesign has made the podcast section unusable. I can't just see a list of my downloaded podcasts which is a terrible redesign. If this doesn't go back I will be cancelling premium.

Been a premium user for four years but user experience just went from excellent to really bad. The app keeps on freezing. It just stops playing the music, trouble connecting to network, doesn't show the artists that I follow, unfollows and unlikes artists and music that I followed and liked, and the list goes on.

The user experience of the Spotify application has gone down drastically after the recent update. There are multiple bugs in the application. I have tried all the troubleshooting tips provided by Spotify but the problems still remain. Kindly fix the user experience problems ASAP in the next update.

I dont use this very often because I have Amazon Music. but when I do use the app and I want to go to an artist, it always says "something went wrong" dispte restarting the app multiple times. Quite irritating.

The only podcast I've ever listened to is Rhett and Link Ear Biscuits- a family friendly show! but suddenly my home page recommended are all obscene things like pornographic shows, white supremacists and other disgusting content- No ability to remove, report or change the recommendations. Still no Chromecast casting as of 5/2021 APP CONSTANTLY DISCONNECTS. Spotify doesn't care about customer service and has been aware of these issues for YEARS. They don't care, just want our money.

Highly unstable as of late. Freezes after exactly 10 minutes now since the most recent update. The redesign itself is a dumpster fire on its own. My neatly organized library is now just a content dump of artists, playlists and podcasts. Aggressive recommendation of certain podcasts is getting worse. Especially when already paying for premium. At least with YouTube Music, no ads means no ads. Also, the lack of account security in this day and age is embarrassing for a company of this size.

The current song progress bar is stuck on something that played the first time I opened the app and I have 5o restart my phone to refresh it. The ux just get messier with every update, making things harder to find. The discover playlist always play the same songs, and there is no way to keep the app from pushing me a few songs I hate no matter what I play.

I don't know what you guys did with the new update but I can't even scroll through my music or podcasts anymore. Everything is out of order and it seems like the sort button keeps getting pressed every time I try to look through anything. It jumps around from top to bottom and won't load right when I click on a podcast or song. It also has been force closing. Please look into it, I love this app, pay for it and use it every day.

I want to preface this by saying I really enjoy using Spotify, but this most recent update has made Spotify UNBEARABLE. Constantly glitching! My 30 minute podcast is showing it's in minute 50. It's so broken. I constantly have to force quit the app so it can reconfigure. Please revert this most recent update!
I am a Wynk user. Downloaded Spotify and found the music quality is awesome and UI design is great. Lakhs of songs. Became a premier member now. Uninstalled Wynk.
Very good app. Could definitely use a find button in each library. Also a way of sorting the songs by artist or title within the library would bring my review up to 5 stars.
App will freeze when playing podcasts where it keeps playing but the play button freezes and the timer remains the same. Happy to change to 5 star once fixed.

been a user since 2018, never had any complaints till now. please fix the sync between the desktop and mobile client, it's been so bad since the UI change! now my phone can't even act as a remote anymore, no music sync is actually happening between the two devices. moreover, with each app update the sync got even worse.. just please work on fixing it :'( PC-mobile sync is now officially at its worst. Please fix it.

Spotify is slowing down the whole system UI, especially when doing certain operations such as play/pause, changing track, etc. Android 10. Speaking as a totally n00b Android Developer, please forward the following word to your development team: "DON'T BLOCK THE UI THREAD FFS!".
Simple, intuitive interface, amazing music suggestion and playlists, great audio quality and other features. Brilliant app.

I love listening to music on this app my favorite thing is that there's not that many ads and you have a choice that you don't have to listen to ads for 30 minutes I love this and it's so quick to install I hope other people have a great experience with the app just like I did I'm a hundred percent team Spotify

I loved Spotify, but since you did the whole library revamp, the app crashes a lot. Sometimes when I open ot, it starts playing the last thing it played and there's no stopping it or choosing something else. 2-3 restarts do the trick but almost makes me quit. Also, the player gets "stuck" with a song and keeps showing it, even if I'm 3 songs down and an entirely different playlist whatsoever (podcasts too). The UI isn't bad, but there's too much neon and bright on an otherwise dark app.

Hate the new update. Always freezes, can no longer switch between music and podcast categories. Insists on sh***y playlists that auto-add podcast episodes. Also, now the skip-ahead button no longer works from the lock screen on my phone. Why even update it if you're just making it more clunky?

Easy to build up and keep library, free to play any song on desktop. I used to be broke and didn't have much money Spotify always let's you listen to your music even if you don't have money. Keep your libraries forever, anywhere. It's been great I can like songs and come back. Think I've been using Spotify since my freshman year 2017, now graduated and got a whole nostalgic trip of lists of songs I like. Spotify was always the best deal, you get much more than any music streaming competitor.

Latest update has brought endless issues and a terrible user experience. Including song info not updating when changing tracks. Generally slow unresponsive app. Will be looking to cancel if nothing improves. Not sure what's changed for Spotify to go down hill recently but I don't feel in it's current state it's worth the premium

The interface, options and features are quite satisfying in this app. Also, the way they show ads without harshly interrupting the listener feels somewhat peaceful. They also cover good to excellent music library in all languages. If you're fond of listening to English music then you're at the right place. I recommend Spotify over any other apps like Jiosaavn and/or Wynk.

It keeps crashing and stops playing music, it keeps saying that it's playing something while it is actually playing something else, the buttons don't work, can't press a different song, restarting doesn't work. I pay for Spotify.

No Internet connection quite often, I have to play music from soundcloud and after 10-15 minutes Spotify app is working.... wow!!! Disappointed! If I press Shuffle it's playing the same songs every time, it's annoying, I will cancel my membership....

Banner that shows the current song sometimes freezes. The buttons and other parts of the app still work, but crash eventually several minutes later. Only a phone restart helps. S21 Android 11, OneUI 3.1.

To any Android users, just download YouTube Vanced, you get YouTube premium and YouTube music premium for free, no ads. The Spotify app is terrible, the whole app needs remaking. Constant bugs, ads in podcasts even though I was on premium, crashes on start up, deletion of downloaded files, failure to download files, video only works on WiFi but only sometimes. Personally I don't like the UI at all either, I know it's personal taste though. I really don't understand why people use Spotify.

Latest update: Poor layout and design not very intuitive. Plus their are bugs within the player itself. When you do finally get to your podcasts, they no longer play correctly. Half way through a podcast the player will display a previous podcast, and skip to a previous part of the audio of the one you are currently listening too (very weird), the control buttons lose their functionality or perform unexpected functions so listening is now very frustrating experience. Hoping for a update to fix

0 stars. I hate the new library view & have reverted to ver 8.6.18.720 from website "Uptodown". In 2019 the user interface went backward in that you no longer can view downloaded songs by artist & album forcing you to create playlists. In May 2021 the default library list now includes everything. No way of defaulting the view to "playlists" only, has only 4 pins & no sort order to list playlists first. This app continues to require more button pushes & steps to find the songs you want to play.

Terrible UX: no lyrics, no comment, to listen to a certain podcast, it takes 7 clicks!! No lyrics in songs. Cannot arrange sequence in a song list. Cannot see the full title of a podcast program which is really ridiculous. Cannot see much of a program title from the podcast list. Cant replay 1 podcast... I would say it s very low cost efficiency comparing with e.g chinese apps. I strongly suggest the product team take a look at how ximalaya, xiami app, take care of their user experience.
developer_response: Hey, we'd love to help get this sorted. If you haven't tried restarting your device yet, we'd suggest giving it a go. If that doesn't do the trick, it'd be best if you reach out to one of our support channels here: https://bit.ly/2zhNwyX.

review_description: Best of breed. I've tried others but still keep coming back to a company that does music streaming really well. App is ready to use and the UX is pretty friendly.

Sometimes, the play button gets stucked and I can't turn off the music. Even when I'm using headphones, instead of stopping the music when I disconnect them it keeps on playing the music. It's got to the point that it happens many more times than it should've been.

Does what its supposed to Edited May 2021.... Doesn't do what it's supposed to... What's happened! Sleep timer no longer works and it has become so glitchy. Quite often the app gets stuck on a track and becomes impossible to navigate. I have reinstalled but to no joy ‚òπÔ∏è

i have spotify on my tablet and i can't see artist's profile. it always says, "something went wrong, have another go?" and everytime i press the try again button nothing would happen. my internet connection is stable and having no problem to play any songs. been tried to re-log in and it doesn't work, tried to reinstall and it works but only until i quit spotify once and go back again. it happens for months already.

Can they just leave it alone? Premium user, maybe not for long. New library sucks. Cuz random is a good way to organize both artists and album titles. Bizarre to just hope the developers quit doing anything
Seem less, well built software. Spotify covers everything from podcasts to weather to any music you like live versions rare versions they tend to have everything

Was good till they did the last update... Now it freezes and, randomly stops all the time. Forgets where you were in an podcast episode, shows you at the beginning when your at the end actually. When you want to stop or play the buttons do not respond when you touch them. Wish I could go back to the last version.

I cancelled last month... You today renewed and charged me. Turns out i have to click several pages of cancel buttons. .. Why? This is misleading. Asked for refund, I don't intend to use the service and wont. If ignored I won't ever be returning to spotify.

I really can't understand why the user experience on my Galaxy Tab is so horrible. For ages the autoplay functionality hasn't worked. After spending an hour with Spotify support no idea why except it randomly works on some albums but not on others. Also very slow to load up, constantly tells me there is no internet connection yet I am getting 40mbps and other apps working fine. I've been using for a number of years and other devices have no issues except for my Samsung Tab.

Spotify used to be a 4 or 5 star app for me, but the new My Library update for Android has made it virtually unusable. So unintuitive to use and it now crashes and shows blank screens, or takes about 20 seconds to load anything INCLUDING my downloads! The fact that podcasts and music are now lumped together in one list is such bad design, as is the case with the whole new My Library update. The old library UI on android was far more user friendly and leagues more intuitive.

2 stars cause it's a good app that I love but recently whatever I play just stops and there's no pause, play, go forward or backwards buttons on the notification tab.. I have to open the app and click play again.. I've had premium since I learned about the app years ago.. sadly not worth it anymore

This app has been flooded with poor reviews but Spotify seems to have given up, and even stopped responding to reviews all together. A huge number of people are having problems with offline mode, loading and other stability issues. For myself, the biggest annoyance has been from adding songs to queue, being greeted with a green circle almost every single tapping the three dot button. It feels like this app has been abandoned for the last year. I don't think Spotify deserves our money anymore.

OK spotify I'm paying for premium I should be able to open the app and play my music without having to wait. There's an annoying glitch that's been going on for some time now every time I open the app it says I have no internet connection and I'm forced to wait for it to buffer or load up and realize that I am connected to a network.. You guys need to fix this issue. Apparently it's happening to quite a few people so it's not just me or a problem with my phone it's a problem with the app.fix it

App is awful lately, lots of skipping, changing the song randomly, and most recently my podcasts skip and the buttons stop responding, only solution is to uninstall and reinstall. Plus the cost for premium is going up, at this point it hardly feels worth it.

Easy to search for and play music and podcasts. I like the fact that it uses wi-fi and Bluetooth for connecting to google speakers as well as headphones. My only wish is that when trying to use my entire home network to play throughout the home there is no guidance on how to achieve this
The apps pretty good but I have one quire, I can't navigate my playlists any more or choose were to start listening from. You also can't move songs within your playlists

I use this app for work. I have personal playlists that I used to quickly access by going to "My Library" and having it set it so my playlists are the first thing to pop up. The latest update made it so I get a jumble of albums and playlists (which if I wanted I would just use the home page), and then I have to click through to playlists->downloaded in order to see my work playlists first. Please allow us to revert our library to the previous layout if desired.

App stops playing when closed. The music app I used before Spotify continued to play in the background even after being shut. This has been a built in feature from Google from nearly a decade ago and Spotify haven't even incorporated it. I plan to cancel my subscription and move app, such a simple feature that means a lot and you haven't bothered to invest in it. Disappointing.

Everything about Spotify is great except one thing that triggers my whole being, the fact that you only get 6 skips per hour. It is really stupid and ruins the whole experience. Absolutely absurd. Also there are some ads which I dont mind that much, but some bugs which are really annoying. Got no choice but to rate it 1 star because of this awful experience.
Everything in my library randomly disappears. I cannot download anything without it also disappearing. This is quite honestly the worst app to use for music.

I have been using Spotify since 2009, and I have been a unlimited/premium member since it was possible, paying around $10 each month for 10 years. That's over $1000... The app has suddenly become a complete mess and wasting my time working around the app, even after the new design. But the worst part is the terrible podcast player, which freezes and stops the episodes, timeline is all over the place, not playing episodes after how you sort the episodes of the podcast and much more. FIX THIS!!!

App keeps freezing and lagging. I need to restart it multiple times before it starts working. Also, the new ui sucks!üëé Fix your app.....app is unresponsive...for god's sake. I just want to listen to music.
Impressive music catalog, across genres and languages. Paid subscription is a must for a fluid experience. Premium prices could be a bit better.

The newest updates are horrible! The buttons in the library are so small. How do you expect people to find those buttons from their car mount while driving. Someone could crash. Also the podcasts used to be sorted by new episode and now I have to swipe and swipe just to find the new episodes! CHANGE IT BACK!!!!!!!

WHAT HAPPENED TO YOUR SERVICE!!! After the latest update: the UI is confusing, bring back the previous one. The add to queue while in offline mode is terrible, the app crash after i add few songs. The overall offline mode is useless i can't stress anymore. Us your customers are paying monthly and this bugs are very dissapointing. Also it takes forever to launch the app even though we have a fast and stable internet connection so dissapointing!!!!
The latest update makes for a frustrating UX. Please stop combining artists, albums, songs and playlists in the Library tab...

We want "slide gesture" for "add to queue" in android too. And search option is quite long process. You guys changed every simple option to complex one. It's a struggle sometimes to use spotify on Android. We want spotify to be more user friendly than it is now, cause we pay for it.

It's so good, and useful for music listeners, Unless they are familiarise on how to get through it all, very beautiful songs, that for years, I couldn't get all in one copy, (rather use to get link from other sources) But this one is very useful and it's related to our kind of music samples, before we can "save" to my own playlist album. No doubt, add at a time of few songs, (what do we expect?, E'thing free ?)Better than radio Helps for my music learning in guitar,violin,flute,harmonica,piano

Utter shite! Another update (20 May 2021) and it's still not working. That's 5 spotify updates in the last fortnight and all they do is make it worse! Still doesn't load up properly and it still keeps saying "no internet connection available". I have a premium account and I can't bloody use it because your updates have ruined it! Sort it out spotify! You are pathetic!

Its a decent music listening with a lot of options, but if youve been using the app for 3+ years like me the constant weird ui changes get annoying and it makes things cluttered and confusing more often than not.

This recent update is awful I've been using premium Spotify for years now. The recent update has made ruined any flow this app once had. The new offline mode is quite unusable, especially when it comes to podcasts.

Been away for a year with Amazon Unlimited but like others I've tried, its messy, buggy and the playlists are poor. This is like picking me songs much more my taste and also the app and whole thing is better. The only thing is amazon was cheaper but id pay the 2 quid extra for a song on demand that I search for on tap rather than try and hunt the album or song. It's the best for mobile as if I wanted higher quality tracks eg WAVS, I'd buy them or something. Its also on my PS4 too, more options
The best ever, all the music and songs i love, including the most beautiful quiet piano and oldies such as Jim Reeves, etc and the quality of the recordings is stunning. Thank you SPOTIFY!
It's switches to different playlist on its own and I don't even have the playlist liked, it's one I use to have liked. I wish you would add a block button to we could block playlist
Amazing app, it has all the songs I beed, even some really obscure ones. The integration with other devices is amazing, the ui is clean, and it's everything I could ask for.
it used to be quite minimum but now ads are getting out of the hand. edit : finally available in my country! price is quite reasonable. few songs are disabled though.

Although spotify does offer a convenient way to listen to a wide music library, I have a few problems with it. Firstly, the offline mode doesn't launch unless you first have a wifi conenction, which is annoying. The app also crashes a lot, or straight up doesn't play music/respond to buttons to skip or pause songs. I have this problem not only on mobile but all platforms. Also spotify kinda scams musicians and doesn't pay them anything. I probably won't keep premium when my student account ends.

the indian app is no where like the original one. there is no shuffle play button no radios nothing. there are only advertisements for premium every two songs. many songs are missing from the original database.

Every update seems like it ruins the app for about 2 weeks then it works fine again until the next update. Currently it will randomly stop playing, fail to show the progress while listening to a song/podcast, fail to change songs/podcasts when selected, and fail to start and pause when listening.

Facing lots of issues since recent update ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è.. Some different song is playing and something else its showing.. downloading already downloaded songs again and again... seriously guys.. it's full of bugs now.. !! Instant fix is required ü§® Other people also facing same issues.. what the hell is going on... I'm a premium user.

Like the old design better. Since the update the Download Que is now Your Episodes. The Download Que used to only have episodes you download only and you can remove them when you're done. Now with Your Episodes it includes all episodes played. Too much clutter. Prefer the previous version before the update. Is there a way to get that version back?
They have larger numbers of membership ads then the songs. So it cause to change your mood due to appearance of ads again and again. It is quite unexpected from spotifyüòî.

The new menu for Library is terrible Podcasts can no longer be sorted by most recent upload. Downloads also now much harder to access. Worst mobile update in all my years of being a subscriber. MAY UPDATE: This has now been rolled out to production. UX stinks. New filters are garbage.

The new redesign is abysmal. It's incredibly frustrating and annoying to find and order my podcasts the way I want them and I don't think it even allows you to organise them by the date they were uploaded anymore. This whole update is just a massive step backward. Utterly hopeless.

Spotify the service is great. The Android app, recently, has been awful. The playbar won"t update when playing so it shows the wrong song and a play button. The only way I can stop playing is to kill the app! If I connect any Bluetooth audio device Spotify starts playing immediately. When using Google Maps on Android Auto, I got snippets of Spotify music instead of audio instructions from Maps.

Was a great app but the latest updates are terrible. As many others have said, it is now difficult to find your own music and downloads and the search function is counterintuitive so it takes too long to find anything. New connectivity issues mean there is almost always a lag with loading the app and playing content. What happened??

Did interns design the UI? (1) The "Search" tab is difficult to navigate because it's an illogical mess, like "Dance/Electronic", "Mood", "Frequency", and "EQUAL" are literally right next to each other. I usually look for playlists based on music genres, and witnessing "Higher Ground" mixed with "Metal" and "Punk" hurts my eyes and my brain. (2) "Your Library" tab is a mess with filter options like a shopping website instead of a tidy curation. I can't find peace even in my own library. Unfair.

Great app but expensive for the ability to skip tracks.. All in all the functions and options all work well on my device and I do like how it functions quickly and personally I've never really had any major issues force closes or lagging while loading my playlists and podcasts.. Would get more stars but for the expense..

Nice music source, huge variety, accessibility and pleasant design. I've tried premium and it's amazing but I couldn't use it forever, so as a free user I don't mind seeing ads. However recently I've started getting 2 ads instead of one and make it more frequent. On top of that only the first ad is sponsored and the second ad is the one that encourages me to buy premium or the one that thanks me for using Spotify and I believe hearing them for the 437th time is unnecessary. Edit: 3 ads now
developer_response: Hey. we appreciate the feedback. If you haven't tried Premium yet, we'd suggest giving our trial a shot so you can listen to music without any interruptions. Just head to http://spotify.com/premium to get started.

review_description: I'm tired of the user experience of the app and I'm thanking of ending my subscription, I have a flagship phone and a high end SD card that I store my downloads on and it doesn't matter whether I'm online or offline the app takes forever to load, slow in response, slow to connect everything is really slow when using the app. I know the IOS app is way better and more responsive and actually have better UX in navigation and playback this Android app should be heading towards that direction.

new update looks like it was designed by amateurs that have never designed an app before. it's completely unintuitive to navigate and frequently used features are hidden. The inability to sort podcasts by new episodes is the dumbest thing I've ever witnessed.

Music is great, app is terrible I love listening to what I want, but the app lags and crashes upon start up, and there's no way to turn off auto-updates for downloaded playlists. Internet is limited where I live, this is quite inconvenient. Content is good, some changes needed.
Gets worse with every update. Instead of fixing the constant lag and inability to connect and stream, we get UI changes no one wanted. (‚ïØ¬∞‚ñ°¬∞Ôºâ‚ïØÔ∏µ ‚îª‚îÅ‚îª
developer_response: Hey, we'd love to help get this fixed. If you haven't tried reinstalling the app and clearing its cache, we'd suggest giving these a shot. review_description: Absolutely terrible, the app crashes all the time when I'm playing podcasts. This new update has completely ruined the app. If you don't fix it you're going to lose a lot of traffic.

The last update broke the app. I can't sign in because the popup with the sign in button doesn't work anymore. I had log in without a password using email. I can no longer get song recommendations at the end of a playlist, just gives an error. PLEASE FIX

Man, ever since it came to Kenya the Canvas feature stopped working, the past 8 updates have been horrible‚Äîit takes too long to load and even sometimes says "no internet connection". Can you please just make the user experience consistently efficient. Like, I understand markets are different but at least make all the features available for third world market.

Spotify aims at a good user experience. There are features that are missing considering a music app but the fetures that are present works flawlessly. And combined with its large database of music I think it is easily ahead of other similar apps like Gaana, Wynk, Apple Music. The only reason I would choose to use other app is the price.
After leaving a Playlist the wrong song is displayed. It is quite infuriating. A temporary fix is shutting your phone off but it only lasts until the Playlist is changed.

Not recommended. Never take paid subscription for this app. I have taken paid subscription but everyday I have to download the same songs again and again to listen offline and waste my data. This app keeps your downloaded songs just for one or two days only. All downloaded songs get deleted automatically and you have to download it again to listen offline. It's better to use it to listen online only as a guest user and never waste your money for subscription. I am quite unhappy.
App spends a lot of time being nonresponsive. Randomly stops playing. Requires restart of both my phone and the app and will still be nonresponsive for hours. Not really worth paying for.
Eq needs work. When implementing the EQ function on this, for an overall better experience, it instantly becomes incredibly quiet and unusable over any kind of power equipment through earbuds.
Latest update is the worst. UI Is garbage,and previously hidden songs are now permanently unplayable with no way to unhide them. Go back to the previous updates!

Far too many ads in the app for how poorly it runs. It crashes on me every day or so. I use the app for podcasts alone, no music. Finding my episodes requires multiple clicks. Came here for Bill Simmons and Rogan. Honestly only staying for that content,unless I find alternatives. The new update makes it even harder to find my shows and episodes. And why exactly does it need an internet connection to play episodes I've already downloaded? Google podcasts was better and that's saying something.
It's okay, but when ever the add where you press the button to get 30 minutes of no add music, i pressed it and in 1 song, an add will pop out of know where, PLEASE FIX THIS!!!!

I personally really, really, really DONT like the new library. It's SO FULL and cluttered now. And I have to push extra buttons, just to have it like it was. Why. Why not let people make the library how they want, and let the people who don't want it just keep how it was. The app went from 5 to 1 star
It's very easy to make a playlist but if you don't have premium you get like 2 songs then 4 adds, that gets very annoying very quick.
Gets the job done, but even after the recent UI update, you STILL can't create Playlist folders within the app. Come on, people have been asking for yeeeeears now.

17 may - anyone with sync across devices issue JUST REINSTALL THE APP & IT WORKS LIKE A CHARM. It worked perfectly for couple of years until the recent updates messed it up. The real-time synching among devices is so messed up. I loved the feature of continuing my music be it I'm listening to it on PC & have to go out but still continue with it. But it's all messed up now. 17 May 2021: 1 star. Now can't even access my library after recent update.

The latest update has made the slightly lag absolutely ridiculous. The load time is SO slow now, especially for the library, the grouping of playlists/artists/albums is unintuitive, and it's still failing to recognise internet connections even when I definitely have one. spotify is convenient but god the android app is leaving a lot to be desired lately.

This new update is so bad. My app constantly crashes because my library is so big and with the new update it all tries to load at once. I just use youtube music now because Spotify never loads anymore. Way to ruin your app lol
Absolutely great music app till date. I switch the app because it's interfere is very easy to use and just click on play button then enjoy to seamless music.

Have to keep deleting this app because it keeps opening and playing even when I have the phone locked..Keeps draining my battery without me knowing and leaving phone battery flat, and phoneless. Not good and very inconvenient. Will NOT be continuing my subscription.

music stop playing after 10 seconds, I've reinstall, restarted my device still cannot fix this. very frustrating because i pay for this app. the solutions from spotify community are not helpful at all, the problem still can't be fixed. spotify need to address this issue quickly because this issue has been going for years.
Slow, buggy, completely non-intuitive UI. Poor recommendations with no way to tell it to stop suggesting truly terrible bands/genres/podcasts.

I rate spotify 4 stars cuz i wont lie, you guys algorithm is too good. But please, could we be allowed to download individual songs??? And also, individual releases should be treated as singles and not albums with just 1 song in them. It messes up the whole experience for offline listening. Thanks alot. Also i would like some changes to the UI/UX, could it be more interactive and nicer looking with a little elements here and there?

After the last update and major change in design the app often appears laggy, not responsive, does not load thumbnails, doesn't load settings or libraries and displays "no internet connection" while there is a connection. Sometimes doing force stop on the app works and sometimes it does not. It's one big lottery now.

New UI is clunky and hard to use. Having to use the "tags" to sort by artist and album rather than the simple library that spotify used to have is awful. Most of my artists disappeared when the changes happened. Please return the option to have the regular library

UPDATE: No longer love this! Spotify kept adding and changing "what they thought I would like to my Playlist!" I did not appreciate that. Would also change what artist I was listening to. I will go back to Pandora! ........ Love this app. Quick click and my favorite songs are all together. ‚ù§

Honestly the new update it awful. The layout is messy and unorganised and getting to my playlist is just annoying as i now have to scroll through albums, artists and podcasts unless i filter it. Which i wouldnt have to do if they just left everything thing in tabs rather than this absolute mess of an app. Ontop of the worst layout Spotify has ever done, now my playlists play from bottom to top when put in recently added and i honestly cant think of a reason for this design
Constantly removing useful contents, UI get worse at every update, connections/stability of the app is terrible and often doesn't work or takes a lot of time to start.

I wish it would stop continuing to play the same track sometimes even after the track is done so that nothing is played until I open back up the app to skip the track. There's been some other bugs preventing music from playing but that's the most common one I've dealt with.

Every single update makes the app exceptionally worse. It used to be when I searched liked artists and downloads, results from my playlists showed up instantly. Now the menus are confusing and the app is slow as hell. The UI was wayyyy better in years past so why continue with pointless "improvements"? If it ain't broke, don't fix it.

Ads about every third song, which seems like nothing but when you're just minding your business trying to listen to some playlist and then get interrupted by some woman whining about the perfection of premium every five-ten minutes, it gets irritating very quickly. Can't skip songs in playlist without premium. Can't play songs when you look them up without premium. Take your premium and shove it. I get that you need money but this is just pathetic. The app is pretty much unusable without paying.

Works great so long as you have a strong wifi/data connection. 4G is not enough it seems. Also the new update made my library an absolute mess. Downloaded music just randomly undownloads itself. I work in a building with spotty connection so I use offline mode frequently. Also would like to be able to select multiple songs/albums/podcasts at once to speed up creating playlists or deleting things.

I can't recommend Spotify. I pay for premium and still get promoted content. It constantly crashes in the background. The company decides to make major UI changes instead of changing how they handle NSFW content (don't let your kids use this app, the "Explicit Content" option does not work, particularly with podcasts and there is no way to hide content you don't want to see).

It had been working well and I even got the subscription but alongside the whole chaos this app has been giving me serious headache the every other time I try to open it my id is always logged out again I have to download my songs and podcasts and then they show errors with connecting to servers a legit good thing got ruined

F#%$ this app and the developers. You offer thirty minutes of music to watch a quick add, then you play 3-4 ads, play a SINGLE song, then it goes back to multiple ads. False advertising at its finest. F&$% you.
Latest update turns music off every 2-3 songs and i have to push the play button to restart. VERY FRUSTRATING!! back to Pandora until its fixed!

Hi, the app is great, can you consider making the car mode option available when playing music either in the 3 dot options or as an icon on the UI while music is playing, I realized that I always had to go to settings to change it when driving and when I get home I have to change back to the normal settings, thanks!

Great app! Great UX! Two suggestions though: 1. Whenever we listen to a playlist, the next time we click on it, all the songs that haven't been listened to should automatically come on top. 2. We need a 'Listened' button next to 'Liked' button cause sometimes we only want to keep in mind that we've listened to this song but don't want to add it to 'Liked' songs. Thanks!

Spotify is a great app for music and I've been on a family plan for years now but this new update is bad. Technically, the app has been failing since the update; I can't listen to anything downloaded if I haven't listened to it recently on Wi-Fi, so premium essentially pointless. And personally, I find the new library menu unintuitive and confusing; all mixed together. Having to scroll through whole podcast catalogues to find old episodes downloaded before the My Episodes feature. Revert it back
Terrible update. The UI is more difficult to navigate and load times have doubled, even for downloaded albums.

Previously loved this app. Update 2 days ago had made it totally unresponsive. Restarted phone, reinstalled app... no go. At first could open app, then no buttons did anything. Now it won't even open. Works on my tablet, but on my Samsung Galaxy S10 it's dead.

Was great but the newest update has made a bug that sucks. When I'm in offline mode and try to queue a song it crashes. Also not a fan of the new ui. Other than that this is a great app for listening to your favorite songs and podcasts.

Awesome way to listen to music but there are quite a few gaps in selection if you want to listen to music from countries outside of North America and Western/Central Europe, especially for traditional forms.
Used to work flawlessly. Now has been extremely slow and glitchy the last 4 months. Update 5/13/21: Unnecessary UI refresh, backend still has major issues. App continously freezes.

Unfortunately, using this app has felt like more of a chore than anything else. The app constantly ceases to function correctly nearly every single time I use it. This app has been suffering from major stability problems that have been documented in a large number of reviews. The only way I have found to make the app somewhat functional is to constantly clear cache and force stop the app. I don't enjoy submitting negative reviews but in this case I feel that it's justified. The app has been suffering from these stability issues for about a year now which I have never seen from a large company. I'm starting to get a bit frustrated with the app's poor user experience, especially considering that the service is a paid subscription. For now, if anyone is experiencing loading issues, try force quitting the app and clearing the cache first before uninstalling the app or restarting your phone.
Don't really love this app, but, could be a replacement for other apps which requires WiFi. With Spotify, I don't need WiFi to play. But, it imposes it's own musics on me when I don't want...
Happy with most of the app. I wish that I could simply hit the "thumbs down" button from any window rather than sometimes having to go into the menue to do it.

I have always wanted to join Spotify but it's just impossible to login. No matter what I try, change password, press the green button in emails, I just can not login. Plus I updated my details on your website. Still can't login. Frustrating

Spotify desperately needs to make a change in how they go about developing their UI for both their desktop and mobile programs. Over the last three years, they have made a habit out of taking one step forward while taking two steps back with each update they release. Looks are valued over functionality and performance. Each update brings decreased performance and the removal of valuable features. Please listen to your user-base, Spotify. Recent reviews are growing increasingly negative.

okay, first of all this app torchers us to buy spotiy premium. It has more adds than songs, for 1 song why do we have to hear 13 adds ?! dont download this app, but theres no choice. Why do we only have spotify as the app to listen music ? so that we learn coding ? you guys and girls are really lucky that u r looking at this, this review was quite helpful and would give u a trailer of this ugh app. Someday ill ban it, and dont dare to delete songs again, sparing u 4 now. bye for now bye.

It worked great for a while, but now it doesn't even load my music. My fiance has the same problem on his phone. The app will tell us we have no internet even when we are connected to wifi or data and every other app that requires internet is working fine. Its beyond frustrating.

Best music streaming out there. App UI/layout navigation is a little cluttered though. Especially with the latest update, the library/playlist/artist etc. are mixed together in one list and you need to tap on (poor)filters to actually pick one category. That's an unnecessary 2-3 steps

The app is lagging big time on my phone. Thinking that it might be because I didn't have enough storage for it to funtion, but it was the same when I emptied my phone. Also, sometimes it behaves as if it wasn't online when I'm connected to the WiFi. All the other apps that I have work perfectly with my WiFi and data connection, except Spotify. It's been like this for months now and it's a quite annoying, specially because I'm paying monthly for this.

They changed the layout a few years back making is much less intuitive, but my biggest gripe is how freaking buggy the app is on the Joe rogan podcast, its always freezing up and allowing me to play what i want

Latest update ruined the app for me. Before, it was a solid 4 stars, but the change to the playlists is so assanine it blows my mind. At LEAST give us a simple toggle in settings to get the old way back, it is not that difficult to implement.

Sooooooo slow it's ridiculous. It takes ages to load artist lists or podcast lists and then ages to load the artist page then ages to start playing. The new podcast menu is terrible and takes more Clicks to get through to new episodes. The play button that comes up when you open the app disappears for several seconds for reasons I'll never understand before it reappears and becomes usable. Very frustrating, especially when I'm paying for it

The app was great until the latest update which now requires me to restart the app numerous times before it is usable. Doesn't respond when initially opened, cannot navigate within the menus. Very annoying as the app worked great until this latest update!
The new way you select items from your library is so cumbersome and not intuitive, it used to be easy to one handed switch artists or albums now it's almost impossible to do without both hands

Most recent update sucks. I genuinely don't understand why apps keep making updates that don't actually improve anything, just make the interface different and more difficult to use while you adjust to it. And then as soon as you get used to it, they change it again. Absolute garbage!

I like this app very much. But there should be a option for replay music. As if you play it in background and do something else in your phone and when the song finishes you need to replay it but there isn't a button for that. You have to open the app and replay. I love this app. Please add this feature. I love it great app. Thanks

The new library screen is horrible. Why would you combine my playlists, artists, and albums into one folder? It looks terrible, is frustrating and inconvenient, and the new "bubble buttons" to select one section look aweful. Why are we racing backwards?

Recent update is pretty garbage, who is thinking this is better? I liked the new albums that would display in the home page...now it only shows one new album. Menu filtering is garbage....why would someone think that removing alphabetical order and replacing it with seemingly random order is better? Some 'ux' experts trying to justify their pay probably
The new library is absolutely outstanding Mind blowing free app to listen all the songs in all languages and podcasts. Continuing to love this app as for the last 6 years üëçüëçüëçüëå

The experience?... Best (Just use the paid version and you are good to go) It's so versatile and I have not problem accessing it from my different devices and continuing to listen to the song that I was listening to.

Amazing app. In Spotify Lyrics showing well in Indian language songs. But in Musixmatch don't show Lyrics with Indian language songs in Android. Musixmatch Lyrics working well in Windows but Spotify does not show lyrics in Windows. . Add some new features- - Lyrics design (colors etc. like Musixmatch) - Word by work Lyrics

Great but kinda janky at times. The notification tab for the app still has songs I search and played for a week ago. Sometimes, it will crash or "short wire" it self randomly to were it'll skip or turn off while the song is playing. But I'll say I like the upcoming and current changes to the UI.

Great service but only on Windows. On Android the playback pauses when other apps play any audio, which is at most annoying. The problem with this is that the app shuts down almost immediately after the music stops. It's not a problem from battery saving or whatever excuse developers are giving, it is a built-in bug that they are ignoring because they'll rather push features that no one asked for such as artists not related to the user's taste. Fix this because it is a PAID service after all!

Latest update is garbage. Takes forever to load, drops all the time, routinely non responsive to any command or click... idk how y'all manage to make this a progressively worse user experience but somehow you pull it off.

I have such a great experience with spotify. I am student and Spotify comes with such a low price that I can afford easily and its adjustable with my pocket money. If we talk about music, Spotify has a large number of artist and their tracks. The also have many categories of different moods. I really recommend this app. Spotify offer different price plans and you can choose which suites you the most. I am lovin' it. More food than SoundCloud

I like to download podcasts to listen to offline. But now if I want to listen to a podcast I downloaded I have to connect to the internet which entirely defeats the purpose of me downloading podcasts in the first place. So for the love of God go back to the old UI that actually worked.

Overal love Spotify but I don't love the recent update to the library. The filtering system means I have to click many buttons to get to my downloaded podcast episodes. They're not the same as New Episodes. And when I do filter down to downloaded podcasts I still have to click into the podcast to find the episode. Music and podcasts are very separate for me and this mixes them all together and it's hard to find what I want. Hopefully this feedback helps in upcoming developments.

A great app for mucic lovers but the only small dislike of these app is about the most ads.As for every two to three songs there is an ad and even the ads have skip option but the design,performance, playlists,songs collection are awesome.

As a music player the only thing that I have experienced bad was, to load or open the local songs, so please fix this problem ASAP, then it will be OPüî•.Other than this everything looks fine, but still even if you have to do edits, then it would be best option for you guys to go for simplifying the UI for easy user experience, so as to get still more user reach.(while reviewing this app I kept only backend and fronted in mind not the actual algorithm using which it works)

WAAAAAY SLOW LO........ ADING Not fun waiting 15 minutes for my library to load each time I get into Spotify. The recent updates have ruined Spotify. About to drop the service after years of no problem.
Will try to make you get in an accident while driving if you listen to anything else. Highjacks audio and wont quit til you force stop or delete the app. Thanks joe.. no thanks spotify.
Was a good app now it is slow to load and buttons become unresponsive. I have also lost the ability to control it from my car stereo when connect by Bluetooth. Good music though

I have been charged my monthly fee for past six months yet forced to watch advertising. There is no way to talk to a person or file a claim with proof of payment. Your compartmentalize business structure is outstanding. I'll be going to I heart or some other scam service. You don't even have a submit button for this feedback. Epic thieves.

I have used the app for many years and with the more recent updates it has become worse. It is now harder to find things you have downloaded, too many sub menus with ease of navigation gone out the window. It continues to try connecting to the Internet slowing the app down and making the music/ podcast skip a bit or stop playing for a few seconds. My last issue is that I'll play a playsuit and when skipping songs skips to another play list altogether. I am now looking for other options.

Spotify in it's first few forms was pretty great. It was intuitive and easy to use. Now with every update it seems they keep changing the UI for no reason. The app has quickly become not intuitive and increasingly difficult to navigate.

Music gets exchangeable. Terrible UI, idiotic recommendations. Billion songs in gazillion playlists for cheap, ok. Fits in a world where artists 'drop songs' rather than albums, where the trend of today is forgotten tomorrow. Welcome to the new world.

Is it possible to switch back to a previous version of the app? App was working great until the latest update, now the ui makes it harder to find my playlists, and on top of that, the app always hangs now.
WHY does the new update require going online to start a downloaded podcast!? It makes the app useless for camping or trail running. I will cancel my premium subscription if this isn't fixed soon.

Review 5üåü‚û°Ô∏è1üåü.The new update is failing in acceptance testing. Why did you move the Save to Your Library "button"? I also hate that now when I add a new album to my playlists it only shows the album title without the artist.
Great for music but the last update has completely ruined the library feature making it more confusing to search for either music or podcasts as they are just lumped together please change it back

Great app, had it for many years but they NEED to add a feature where you can remove multiple songs from a playlist at once. Accidentally imported over 5000 sound bites from my phone and its ruined my Liked playlist since Spotify automatically 'likes' anything you import. Have to 'unlike' them one by one which would take hours. Can't us PC for this either. Has killed the app for me.

Thank you, most recent update (10/5), for RUINING my personal order of playlists with your new filtering system on the mobile app. You could have added an "old" or "personal" option but no. Why assume people have a preference. That'd make them individuals and that just doesn't happen.

Spotify is my primary music app, but please please PLEASE undo the most recent update. it has removed All Functionality of the saved music library and has completely ruined the experience of using the app. Undo it, and I think a lot of people will be much happier. Edit 5/9/2021: every update gets worse. Thanks i hate it
Spotify makes into my Top 3 apps in the world which I can't live without. Interactive UI and visual experience is undeniably industry leading ! Great Great Great service üëåüëç 5/5 Stars

Disgraceful UI, specially for a supposedly tech firm. An UX designer intern would do better after a 30 minutes browse on Google's Material design from some 10 years ago. Selecting content only possible one by one, never heard of long press multiselection, really? Then removing them is 2 clicks, each? Even worse, selection adds to Your Episodes, which does not appear on the Garmin watch side, so need to use the three dot + add episode + select playlist route, 3 click for each piece of content?

This new update is horrible. All I want is to go to 'My Playlists' and see them in the order that I chose. Not some 'dynamic' changing thing, i dont want to have to filter my library when i go there.. quick, easy playlist selection is gone. Let me roll back to a previous version. To get to my playlist list, i now have to select playlist, select downloaded (because they dont show otherwise), change the sort to something else, then back to 'Custom Order' Roll back these changes. They are brutal.

I've been using Spotify for years and it used to be the best! But the new app layout is frustrating to find my downloaded podcasts - I'll pick a song and it'll shuffle two seconds later - the app glitches and kicks me out half the time. And seriously this new update sucks. If I'm not connected to WiFi it takes forever to load anything and it hides all my downloaded stuff in its li'l menu button. Probably gonna cancel my premium soon. Not a fan

New update causes playlist to play songs in reverse order when sorted by recently added. I like to listen so songs I've added to my dump playlist most recently to and it's completely ruined the way I listen to music. Fix it please or I'll be using a different a different service.

First few days were fine but now I can't get music playing. I had Google Play Music which was waaay better. This was my only go to and it is a fail for me at this time. I can't buy a subscription for something that keeps loading and does nothing with or without wifi access. I also miss having the option of searching for a song and finding it right away as I need music while driving I want to find my exact song quickly. Spotify finds it and charges me if I want to hear it. That should be sample

The default storage keeps switching from the SD card to the stupid internal storage. That means that I have to redownload many gigabytes worth of songs every once in a while, that wasn't the case a few weeks ago. The new UI is not very good either, please fix it!

Tha app was rather good, but last updates was just bad. Very bad. They just ruined the app. I suggest users to roll back to version 8.5.89.901. I suggest developers to take it seriously and notify users when the new version will be actually better then the old one.

Great app and great service overall. But. The "Behind the Lyrics" system works in a completely non-intuitive way, it tries to pack too much ‚Äî facts about the song and real-time lyrics and misses both shots for me. Also, most of the songs don't show the lyrics at all which is sad.
Please remember my sorting preferences. Who wants to see their oldest track first in a playlist? And also, a green button should confirm. It's confusing that it confirms to not add a track double.

I used this app for half a year and I had Premium, after that the app required to renew the bank card info or something..After this it logged out and when I logged in there was no music that I added at all. I don't remember artists and names of the songs and it makes me sad cause I can't listen to my favorite songs anymore....

I didnt feel like supporting Facebook Group of companies and moved to yt music its just as good same price ....it was stuffing up at first then i uninstalled spotify and its fine. Annoyingly spotify keeps asking me to sign back up. Sorry spotify if ive hit the cancel button im well aware of my decision.

The Your Library update makes is unintuitive and deliberately breaks the workflow of listeners. I really don't want to have to spend 30 seconds sorting my library every time I open the app before I can put music on. It's ridiculous and was frankly my last straw. Ending my subscription and moving to Apple Music.

New UI sucks so bad. Didn't know it was possible to be made worse but somehow Spotify managed. Terrible app. UPDATE: It gets worse, the search function won't even pull up albums that u have downloaded. Absolute trash. Gonna wait a couple weeks and see if they fix it. Otherwise I'm looking for a different streaming service.

Ive been a premium user since 2015. This app has simply gotten worse and worse. The UI is frequently changed to the detriment of finding your music, and after the latest update it rarely even let's me use the menus or play music before freezing with "no connection."
Always freezing and not able to always connect via Bluetooth after "UPDATE". You would think something you pay for would actually work the way it's designed.

The new(er) UI is even worse than before! And please, stop with the race and political advertising. Stop recommending it to me, I don't want to listen to Barack Obama with Bruce Springsteen or the most popular "Are and Be" songs that I could care less about.

Why does my forward button not go down the list of my playlist anymore...? If I play the top song I can't forward to the one below it... Would like this to get fixed. Seems like a very unnecessary and annoying update.
Last update made the UI a pain to deal with, before all my music and podcasts would be organized, now when I open it I have to organize myself everytime. Go back.

Amazing app for music; wide variety if stuff for a guy like me who listens to all types of music. It also has great podcasts, so I don't get bored in class and I can just stop paying attention XD. They're even self-conscious about how much ads suck, unlike mobile games or other websites that want to shout them from the rooftop. Premium is a little expensive ($10/month), but well worth it. This is BUILT for music and podcasts, and by hell does it succeed.

Great App. This app is great for my purpouses, you can listen to the music you want whenever! Although when you are looking for music to listen to out and about look elsewhere, you cant listen to music offline :( But if you get Spotify Premium, you can download music and listen to it ad free. The ads are quite annoying, and one thing i have been noticing is when i listen to my playlist, it always shuffle plays ( unless you are listening on desktop) its not a big problem but hope they fix it soon

I love Spotify because, it's easy to search for the songs, it's easy to build your playlist and I love that it makes suggestions based on your taste of music. I'm a 60s-70s child and love that they have a huge play list of bubblegum music. It's nice to remember my teenie bopper days of youth listening to the likes of Tony DeFranco, Leif Garrett, Shawn Cassidy and Bobby Sherman! ü•∞

Who needs this junk when you can fill your device with thousands of songs? Doesn't interrupt your music with ads, doesn't require a subscription, and doesn't rely on an internet connection. And spotify doesn't have a graphic equalizer, my .mp3 player does.

The last update's new library tab ruined the whole Spotify experience for me. Also, if I am in an area without cell reception, I need to go into airplane mode to see my downloaded tracks. Otherwise the app constantly tries to pull data, which it obviously can't.

I love spotify on desktop. But the Android app is sooo bad. I often don't have the patience to wait for the app to finally respond on my phone. I switched to Google Podcast to listen to podcasts. Free and much quicker. Spotify is my only paying app and it is also the worst. I keep hoping they will wake up one day as I love the platform.
Most recent update was so unnecessary and changed the entire user experience and functionality.. Provide the option to change back to old layout please??!!

We are still getting to know each other, and it's quite a shorthand we have developed so far. I like how it looks and behaves, it's easy and pleasant to work with. Sometimes we have a bad week and I don't approve the choice made for me, but I know we will get along. And we do, always. Just a few words to contribute to those who cannot afford Premium.
